website_summaries.verdict: A well-priced device that’s easy to operate and reads and writes to M-DISCs.
pros: Fair data transfer speeds for this price range
Easily recognized by most computer systems
cons: Concerns about thin construction, so needs careful handling

customer_reviews.title: Worked for about 10 CDs
customer_reviews.text: Yeah, I bought this back in 2015. At first, it started out as a really great drive. I was a little concerned because it felt weak and I've had problems with LG brand products in the past (my dishwasher didn't last more than a month and the fridge has problems) It burned by discs great up until right about now. Keep in mind that although I've had this for almost 7 months, it never leaves my desk and I've only burned about 10 discs on it. Needless to say, it won't read any discs I put in it. At least it was cheap. Shop for something worth your money, please. I've made my mistake with this one.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Junk - failed within an hour of use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for the simple desire to import 6 CD's into my iTunes. Three songs left on the sixth CD, the unit started making a repetitive clicking noise and stopped importing. Attempts to restart failed. Attempted other CD's with no luck. After a few other attempts, the unit failed to respond at all. Cheap crap. I am not usually a 1-star rater...but in this instance, full failure of the unit after relatively little use is unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: MJRAVL

customer_reviews.title: Great portable DVD RW!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little drive! It's very lightweight and portable but also sturdy. It has already taken a tumble (about 2 feet down to carpet) while I was installing software on 2nd computer. It landed upside down and the disk inside dislodged. I unplugged the USB cable from the PC then plugged back in, opened the tray and reseated disk, then went again with install. No problems. Highly recommend! (Don't you just love LG products?!!)
customer_reviews.author: HappyDad

customer_reviews.title: Disgusted!!
customer_reviews.text: Worked once great...then came the heartache. It says it's making a dvd...says it completes the dvd...but Gee I can't play the dvd. The software is not all that complete either....The program I received did not contain the video portion in the menu...just directed me to purchase more software. Are you kidding? I The one dvd I was able to make had to be initialized from a different program entirely. I'm disgusted with the amount of time I have spent on this (2 Days). * I asked a question to a user who posted 5 stars right after my review. I did not receive an answer and I see now they removed their review. HOW SHADY
customer_reviews.author: E. Kinane

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for infrequent use with my desktop machine, which lacks an optical drive (my preference). After using this drive a handful of times I'm happy to report that it works great. It comes with a mini-usb to usb cable that connects to any usb port, and Linux Mint immediately recognized it. Burns CDs and DVDs w/out issue. Although being an optical drive, it does make noticeable noise while in use, but nothing out of the ordinary. Overall a great product so far and I look forward to using it on an as-needed basis.
customer_reviews.author: Marco

customer_reviews.title: BEST ON THE MARKET!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this device since July of 2015, it is now April of 2017 and it is still going strong! I have used this to copy thousands of cd's and dvd's not including the thousands of cd's I have transferred into my iTunes account! It is AMAZING! I am buying another one today to keep at work to play CDs and DVDs!
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: works fine but is very fragile
customer_reviews.text: It worked fine for a while. You have to be really careful the way you put the DVD in. Sometimes it takes a few tries to get it to play. You have to keep taking it out and putting it back in. Still, it worked well enough. Then today I knocked it off of a table. It fell only 2 feet and landed on a floor that had two rugs on it, but now it doesn't work it all, doesn't even close. The warranty doesn't cover accidental damage, so I'm out $40. :(
customer_reviews.author: Anna Henson

customer_reviews.title: Does not work on Surface Pro 3
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Surface Pro 3 and it reads sometimes and fails on write every time. When it fails, it hangs the laptop and I need to reboot. Figuring I just got a bad unit, I purchased a second one and got the same results. After doing a lot of research, my conclusions are that the Surface Pro 3 and many other ultra thin laptops have insufficient USB power to drive most portable DVD/CD drives. I have purchased a Y cable to test this theory. Meanwhile, LG, who typically provides excellent product, should find a solution and make it available (extra cost is OK) and describe the solution in its listings for low powered USB computers.
customer_reviews.author: L. Olson

customer_reviews.title: At first I was confused and upset because there were ...
customer_reviews.text: At first I was confused and upset because there were no instructions on how to use this device with MAC. Logically, I assumed it to be plug n play but it confused me when I couldn't view it in the "finder" for MAC OS. After some fiddling around and logging onto customer service I discovered it is plug n play. Despite not being able to view the device in "finder" you can stick in a disk and it will operate on the MAC OS. This product lacks proper instructions and disclaimers. It only provides information for Windows, which is why it is confusing whether it is even compatable. However, it is compatable with MAC OS.
customer_reviews.author: Joshl74

customer_reviews.title: get what ya pay for
customer_reviews.text: It works, but feels incredibly cheap. The price I paid matches the quality, but I wish I had gotten a bit better one. The tray is like an old laptop tray. I feel like a slotted model would be much better. The USB mini port is super antiquated and gives me a bad vibe. It seems like most devices that use the old style port don't have a very long life expectancy.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Good external drive.
customer_reviews.text: I got this to use with my Notebook so that I could watch DVD's while on the road as we had some upcoming trips planned. It has no problem what so ever with reading my DVD's, which is great. I've also used it to install a few programs onto my Notebook without a hitch. It's very light, so it travels easily. The only problem I had is that it is extremely sensitive to any kind of movement, to the point that a barely noticeable bump in the road rendered it useless. Still a good deal for the price, and does what it's supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money even 4 or so years later
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for coming on 5 years and I haven't had any issues and I recently hooked this up to my new gaming PC and it's been smooth sailing because it hooked up and windows downloaded the drivers without any issues. This was well worth it's weight in gold.
customer_reviews.author: kamala marin

customer_reviews.title: Worked great so far(had it for a couple of weeks)
customer_reviews.text: Worked great so far(had it for a couple of weeks). Power2Go software it came with is a lite version. You might need to upgrade to a full version to take advantage of their other recording option (i.e. DVD-video). But for what I use it for me... its fine; for playing DVD movies/music CD on a laptop without a DVD drive and/or used for backing up personal files to DVD (data disc).
customer_reviews.author: my2cents

customer_reviews.title: Good looking and working drive. Time will tell if it lasts.
customer_reviews.text: This was a refurbished drive in original packaging. The product looked new. Works fine. Connects direct to Win 7 & Win 10 with no need for drivers. The only way I could tell it was refurb was that the remanufacturer had placed their label over the warranty details on the box and the bottom of the drive. I recommend this product. Only time will tell if it lasts, and I will change this post if the drive fails early.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Coulthard

customer_reviews.title: Small, cheap, powers off USB, does the job.
customer_reviews.text: About a month ago I was clearing out old VCRs, CRT monitors, and other outdated junk, so I tossed an external DVD player/burner that had been sitting around unused for over 10 years. I assumed that all new computers would come with DVD built in. Well, my wife just got a new 2-in-1 (tablet/notebook) computer with no DVD and I just got an all-in-one computer with no DVD. Wish I had that DVD player back. At least DVD players/burners are dirt cheap these days. Plus this one is about a fourth the thickness of the old one and powers off the USB, so no extra power cord runs to it. I hardly know its there.
customer_reviews.author: ShoppingGeek

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality and Cheaply made.
customer_reviews.text: Product feels very cheap and flimsy. Does not feel like it will hold up at all for very long as a portable drive. The plastic feels very thin and cheaply made. I'm not sure how this is the #1 best seller for this category. That is what influenced my purchase but if I had to do it again I'd pass on this and spend the extra money for the Apple made superdrive.
customer_reviews.author: GoKartMozart

customer_reviews.title: For being super cheap it's lasted a couple of years
customer_reviews.text: For being super cheap it's lasted a couple of years. I only bought it because my computer has no drive and I wanted to upload software and be able to access files from my previous computer that I had burned onto disks. It worked just fine for both and also for burning both data and music disks.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Not a speed demon (6X max DVD -R burn) but ...
customer_reviews.text: Not a speed demon (6X max DVD -R burn) but it was plug and play on a new iMac running OSX 10.11.3. Took less than 5 sec. Plugged it into a hub, stuck the DVD in, selected a folder to burn and it started immediately. It does appear to be very fragile in it's construction so I would say that TLC is required when in use.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Rip Away
customer_reviews.text: One of the most practical solutions for my laptop which didn't come with a DVD player. Plug it in, press it on the side, insert disc and you're ready to go. Has a very light-weight feel to it. I don't want to say "cheap" feel, but it is a little flimsy. Don't let that deter you from purchasing one though. It still gets the job done very well.
customer_reviews.author: Worthy Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: If you get a good drive, this can be an exceptional model
customer_reviews.text: The first one of these I purchased lasted for over a year and was extremely reliable. I was buying drives by Samsung previously that were only lasting about a month with heavy use. Unfortunately, the 2nd and 3rd drive from LG I've purchased have not been as long lasting. In fact, the second drive only lasted reliably about a month (It still burns discs tho but produces as many failures as successes and makes some strange noises now). If you get a good drive, this can be an exceptional model. Otherwise, certainly no worse than other brands at least. I do appreciate that it only takes one USB port on your laptop to power unlike some similar devices.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Konarz

customer_reviews.title: This LG DVD drive works fine. Just what you would want in a slim
customer_reviews.text: This LG DVD drive works fine. Just what you would want in a slim, external DVD drive. ****I was NOT provided this item for free or at a discounted price. I just like to buy things and try to help the next consumer by writing up my experience****
customer_reviews.author: Joe B

customer_reviews.title: its ok but would not buy again.....
customer_reviews.text: worked at first then wouldn't work with my laptop.... dont know what the problem is but I wont buy another one of these.... could be my laptop but I dont know, it says doesn't recognize so I am just giving 3 stars because I was only able to use it for a short time.....
customer_reviews.author: Dale Hilker

customer_reviews.title: Not for me.
customer_reviews.text: This really seems well built and I wish it could have worked for my needs. I read many reviews and hoped it would work with my tablets and my Chromebook. It did not. It worked really well plugged into a windows operating device, but I don't need one for that purpose. One question was answered that it would run on a Chromebook so I took a chance. It would read the movie I put in but I could not find an app or other way to view it. Maybe down the road one will be made for android or Google.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Does what it’s supposed to!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. For the price, it does what it’s supposed to do. I knocked off one star just because sometimes the CD slot doesn’t hold the CD very well. But as long as you don’t shake it or drop the CD player when the CD is in, you shouldn’t have a problem .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The only DVD it didn't like was one from the library
customer_reviews.text: Works really well. I don't use it tons but when I do I have no problems. The only DVD it didn't like was one from the library. But that's because they put extra security labels on that are a little thick make them run badly. No fault of this product of course. My grandparents need one too and I recommended this one. It's nice and compact and easy to store when not using.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So I bought this as well as the LG SP80NB60 ...
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this as well as the LG SP80NB60 from bestbuy, as I needed it in a pinch, and I really can't seem to tell the difference, except bestbuy is selling the SP80 for about $10 more. I think this one is a bit sleeker and nicer looking, so if you have the option, save the $10 and get this instead. I think they must have their own bestbuy specific model so you can't pricematch it or something, cause I can't find that model anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Xero

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work from the moment it was unpacked.
customer_reviews.text: Despite trying this drive on a MAC and a NEW PC, it would never work. It would flash its little green light then stop. DOA I suppose. What has happened to LG's quality? Really disappointed that we had to order an older model to find one that would work. DON'T BUY THIS PRODUCT! Save yourself a headache and Amazon one too.
customer_reviews.author: I Love Lucy

customer_reviews.title: happy customer
customer_reviews.text: I haven't been using it all that long - hence the 4 star rating. It appears well made. Comments about the tray being flimsy seem unfounded to me. It is at least as durable as most laptops or desktop optical drives. I have used it to load a few large programs into my netbook without any difficulties. Viewed a movie on DVD and played back flawlessly with very little unit noise. We'll see how well it holds up for the future, but would recommend this unit for its quality and low cost.
customer_reviews.author: Retread

customer_reviews.title: I only take this out when needed (keep it in the box it came in otherwise) but I'd just recommend that you be careful since it i
customer_reviews.text: Less solid and lighter than I was expecting. However, setup was minimal and works for writing/reading CDs and DVDs with no problem. I only take this out when needed (keep it in the box it came in otherwise) but I'd just recommend that you be careful since it is very light and can very easily be moved by way of the USB cord if you're not careful (it doesn't have enough weight to resist movement). Overall, I just really like how easy it is to use.
customer_reviews.author: rhowge

customer_reviews.title: As Expected
customer_reviews.text: Worked great under Mac/Windows/Linux with no drivers. Was able to burn both CD-R and DVD-R no problem.
customer_reviews.author: DRE

customer_reviews.title: Works with Mac OSX Yosemite 10.10.2
customer_reviews.text: Worked great out of the box with Mac OSX Yosemite 10.10.2. No drivers required. I burned audio and data CDs with both Burn.app and Audio Hijack Pro. Runs quick and reasonably quiet without a much vibration. Really pretty amazing for under $30.
customer_reviews.author: P. Wenzel

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Works fine, small and quiet - especially considering the low price. Get the GP60NB50 Hermitshell case to store it.
customer_reviews.author: J.Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: For the money, you really can't beat this little guy. I received it quickly in the mail and plugged it into my Macbook Pro. It was immediately ready to go and so far, has flawlessly copied CD's to my iTunes account, played CD's and DVD's and burned CD's pretty quickly. As others have said, it's probably not the most durable thing in the world but as long as you don't drop it or generally beat it up, it's great. I'm very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: modus77

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done, all I needed.
customer_reviews.text: It's so sad that laptops don't really have disk drives anymore. For the price, this is perfect for my casual CD use. You'll need to download something to watch movies on your laptop though (found that out on a planned movie night...). I suppose some people would find it noisy at times when it runs a disk, but I don' really mind it. Get's the job done. Highly recommend it if you want a low priced disk drive.
customer_reviews.author: K_Renny

customer_reviews.title: which broke away on one side (that was easily glued back in place
customer_reviews.text: After using it nearly constantly for a year, it's working perfectly. The only problems are (1) that the tray has fragile supports on the edges, which broke away on one side (that was easily glued back in place, though), and (2) that the tray doesn't quite clear the body when open, making it a bit difficult to insert and remove a disk, potentially causing the disk to be scratched if care isn't taken.
customer_reviews.author: Karkus Walker

customer_reviews.title: Lovely.
customer_reviews.text: After I realized that (duh) my expensive new super-thin lightweight ultrabook didn't have a built in CD drive and I actually needed one... I panicked for a second, then thought "there is probably such a thing as an external CD drive, and it'll definitely be on Amazon." Found it, bought it, plugged it in. The drive worked perfectly without any installation necessary. Very lightweight and portable but also seems durable. So, now I have a CD drive and I don't have to lug it around with me everywhere I take my laptop... Win-win.
customer_reviews.author: Angelica Stanton

customer_reviews.title: but so far this is a fine drive. I'll come back in a few months ...
customer_reviews.text: Pulled it out of the box, connected the USB to my Surface Pro 3 and there it was ready to use. I then installed some of the included software from their DVD, no problems. First day of use, but so far this is a fine drive. I'll come back in a few months if I think of it and let you know how it held up. If you hear nothing, then there were still no problems and I just forgot I had it.
customer_reviews.author: Lostviking

customer_reviews.title: Vibrates more than I would like.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because some of the new computers do not have CD-DVD drives any more. Have only used it a few times. It does seem to vibrate more that I would like. When I have a file to write to CD or DVD I usually transfer it to an old computer with an internal CD-DVD drive with Linux Mint OS which does an excellent job of writing CD's and DVD's.
customer_reviews.author: al

customer_reviews.title: Works as well as my desktop CD/DVD reader.
customer_reviews.text: I'd post 5 star, but I had to disconnect and reconnect it once to get windows (8.1) to allow me to eject a disk. Otherwise speed seems fine (about as fast as the disc reader in my desktop), not sure if USB 3 makes any difference, but that is what I have on my laptop. Construction seems very light and flimsy, but this is not exactly an expensive buy, so I'll let that pass. I've not burned any discs yet, I will update if I do.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Mcmillan

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with XP/SP3, at least mine
customer_reviews.text: Well, even though it's supposed to work with XP (according to the product info) it just freezes (XP Home/SP 3). Not even Control, Alt, Del works - I have to reboot from the power switch! But, I'll be soon adding my Acer Vista to the workstation, so maybe it will work with that. I hope. I have many movie DVD's and have no way to play them! Very frustrating!
customer_reviews.author: Celtic Patriot Scotty

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, but some older Toshiba laptops may not recognize it.
customer_reviews.text: Reducing one start because one of my 3 computer will not detect it. It works, but has some limitations. All my computers are running Win7 x64 so it is not the OS. The one computer that won't recognize it is a R930 Toshiba laptop, but my other Toshiba laptop(Z40) does see it, which is the main reason I got it. The Z40 doesn't have a CD-ROM drive. My Dell desktop reads it. Only put it there to test it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M.

customer_reviews.title: Delete your old burner from the desktop components to enable the LG to work properly!
customer_reviews.text: Works superbly and a true value for the price. Interfaces perfectly with Real Player. However, if you have a desktop tower as I do, be sure to delete the old burner as the LG will not play or record properly if the built-in old burner is not removed from your hardware components. I wish the quick start guide was more detailed and had included this information!
customer_reviews.author: Paul E. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Works well, if you know what you're doing.
customer_reviews.text: This is a LOT cheaper than software copiers, and easy to use. However, you should still become acquainted with the options and how they work. When I tried to copy a whole disk, I got a message that my blank disk did not have enough room. So I decided to drag and drop the files and then delete part of them, planning to make two disks. Imagine my surprise when ALL the files got copied! I have no idea why this worked, but I'm glad it did.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a great add-on peripheral for slim notebooks with no built in ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great add-on peripheral for slim notebooks with no built in CD drive. I use it with a MacBook air. It's simple plug and play, no driver installation needed. And unlike some other drives of this type, it is low power enough that it requires a single USB connection. Read performance is excellent. Write performance is decent, though that was not the main concern for me.
customer_reviews.author: hgaphoto

customer_reviews.title: LG JUNK, WEAK!  Lasted 4 months!
customer_reviews.text: Got it Sept 1, 2016 and after 4 months it's already dead. Have used it less than 10 times, yes 10 times! 1 star is over rating this piece of LG junk. Tried different cords and USB ports to make sure it wasn't either of those. 90 day warranty. Never buying LG again!
customer_reviews.author: Walt

customer_reviews.title: It works just like a laptop optical drive with popping out when the ...
customer_reviews.text: It works just like a laptop optical drive with popping out when the button is press, works off USB power which I needed, and does everything expected. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Bolovschak

customer_reviews.title: Does not work at all
customer_reviews.text: Bought this last year, but just now tried it for the first time and it DOESN'T WORK. It makes a loud whirring sound when I put a dvd inside it. Tried a few troubleshooting things, but it never worked. Too bad I waited so long to try it, bc now I have this 25$ piece of garbage and still have to find a dvd player. Will not be trying lg again!
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: brought for someone else and got hooked!
customer_reviews.text: I've done for a friend of mine who needed burning ond cd - rome disc, and I've done it with a little and a lot of music or data burning. But still using music to burn to cd - rom disc. Both ways worked so well, and I just love the product, that I had to get one for myself as well. I paid less for mine and I'm happy about that.This product is excellent in my book.
customer_reviews.author: sandy

customer_reviews.title: Great value, very convenient, minimal wires
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little drive! No power supply is needed and it only uses one USB cable. (I noticed some required two, one for communications and one for power). I'm using this drive for various purposes, the main one being to use it on my Microsoft Surface Pro and RT. I also used it to reinstall an operating system on a laptop with no CD drive after replacing the hard drive. For the money you can't beat this little drive.
customer_reviews.author: PM12

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 3 weeks, then starts clicking and blinking.
customer_reviews.text: This thing was a piece of junk. I had it for about 3 weeks and made about 5 DVDs before this thing broke (clicking and blinking). Not worth returning and wasting time...who knows maybe I got a bad one, take your chances!
customer_reviews.author: Dz

customer_reviews.title: Annoying from the first, Not working now
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in September, 2015 for an HP mini desktop mini computer. The software was always a little annoying, but we worked around that. Well, as long as it worked. Now, it's just stopped working. Nothing. Even tried different cables, ports, computers. Dead. Since dead CD-RW drives neither read nor write CDs, makes this useless. Last LG peripheral we're buying.
customer_reviews.author: Marie C.

customer_reviews.title: I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this without looking at the specs. When it came, I realized it didn't have W10 listed as an OS. I plugged it in anyway figuring I could find a driver somewhere...It came right up as an available device... and I can read and write without issue. I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: KarlaB

customer_reviews.title: Several months with no issues
customer_reviews.text: I use this at work to image laptops since most are doing away with physical media drives. I use an image tool that's burned onto a DVD and leave it in this drive. I just use it to image and throw it back in my drawer. It's worked great for the last several months with no issues on any machine. Computer recognizes it right away on boot and automatically loads what's in the drive
customer_reviews.author: Oscar

customer_reviews.title: Not too good.
customer_reviews.text: Delivery was great. A little bit of trouble installing the program that came with it. I don't think I need the program to run it and the Cyborg program is screwing up my computer. When I turn the computer on, it asks if I want to let it make a change, I think I'm going to delete the Cyborg program that came with it. I also don't need the constant emails that is sent.
customer_reviews.author: Mike F

customer_reviews.title: No problems.
customer_reviews.text: I works really well. I also discovered that you can use it on a laptop for the whole duration of a movie and it will not drain your battery. I recommend it to someone looking for a external dvdrw. FIve stars because it does what it is supposed to do, it is very reliable, and it is cheap. If you are looking to buy something that does the job in read and writing DVDs, I recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Tovar

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I needed this because my mac air doens't come with a cd drive. You don't need to install anything just plug in and start using it. I use it to read and burn CD. Very fast and reliable. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: JULIA DUAN

customer_reviews.title: The included software: cyberlink media suite 10, did not install on windows 8.1.
customer_reviews.text: The included software: Cyberlink media suite 10, did not install on windows 8.1. The latest version of the Cyberlink media suite is 12. I wish it was bundled with the drive. And the drive seems very slow in reading and writing. I won't return it because it is not worth the effort. I'll try another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this DVD burner to rip several cd's to my itunes library and it works great! I have a toshiba Protege ultrabook and my family uses all Mac computers, none of us have had any problems with it! I would say the speed is about average for the price. If you are looking for a faster DVD burner, Samsung and other top brands would fit the bill. I'm simple, so this purchase was perfect for me! It arrived within 3 business days!
customer_reviews.author: M. Anji

customer_reviews.title: Rock solid DVD/CD player.
customer_reviews.text: Still going strong after 6 months. Getting DVD players to last has become a real problem. I'm lucky to get a year our of most. So far I've played movies, ready hundreds of backup CDs and DVDs without a problem. Light and durable, an excellent choice for either desktop or laptop. I haven't burned anything with it thus far however. So I am unsure about how it will function as a burner.
customer_reviews.author: Drac Smith

customer_reviews.title: LG Electronics 8X USB 2.0 Slim Portable...Review
customer_reviews.text: Already have one of these for one of my laptops. Since newer laptops don't come with CD/DVD drives much anymore, I needed this to use my movies and load software (from other than thumb drives). It comes in quite handy and is easy to use. I got this second one for my grandson's computer. Will have to show him what to do; but, its simple. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Dwranny

customer_reviews.title: " and then continues to play the movie rather that freeze up like other players I have had
customer_reviews.text: Got this item to play DVDs. First product I have ever purchased that you "just plug it in and turn it on" and it works! I borrow DVDs from my local library, and sometimes they have been abused. This play provides a message, "Skipping over damaged area," and then continues to play the movie rather that freeze up like other players I have had. So glad I got this!
customer_reviews.author: MissChris

customer_reviews.title: Good price, good product for this inexpensive price
customer_reviews.text: Good price, good product for this inexpensive price. I just started using it to import a CD and the drive runs extremely slow; more than a 1-2 minutes for each song to import. It's an okay product. At least it gets the job done (though at a painfully slow pace). I like the size; small and lightweight for travel. It is sort of flimsy, though so just be careful when handling it.
customer_reviews.author: Bebe

customer_reviews.title: Support was poor and their only answer was to call Apple
customer_reviews.text: Product did not work with my Mac even though it was supposed to. Support was poor and their only answer was to call Apple.
customer_reviews.author: John Woodhouse

customer_reviews.title: MUST HAVE!!
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought a laptop with no CD drive and I must say, this is a life saver. It only uses one USB port, and really sleek and modern looking. The drive itself is very finctional and does a good job of reding DVDs and CDs and even burcing a CD of the album NWA that I purchased digitally from Amazon Music. Ive had jt for a while and it is still going strong. Definitely worth recommending to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Works well & has more features than other units in this price range
customer_reviews.text: My dvd drive went out on my HP Pavillion so I decided to shop for an external DVD+/-RW drive. This unit does everything its info sheet advertised and does it well. It has far more features than other units I viewed in its price range. I would highly recommend you consider it before buying.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Hoffpauir

customer_reviews.title: Device Driver would not load
customer_reviews.text: Did not work for me win 7 64 bit computer. The device manager recognize the device but the device driver could not be installed. The installation disc that comes with the DVD player would not recognize the device even though it was correct in the device manager. There is no inf (driver file) on the disc and I could not find one at LG or anywhere on the internet.
customer_reviews.author: M. Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Nice slim portable DVD reader/writer
customer_reviews.text: Anymore, it's getting very rare to have a DVD drive built into a laptop and that's where portable DVD reader/writers come in handy. I tested burning Windows Server 2008 with this and had no issues. I ripped a few music CDs with it as well and had no trouble. It does it's job and I'm quite happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Techno T

customer_reviews.title: LG can do better
customer_reviews.text: The installation of the software for this was slow. At times, the process seemed to go back and start over. The instructions were not clear. The performance so far has been spotty for mp3 files, in that the last 10-12 (out of 150) files will be corrupted, and will skip during playback. When it works, it works well. I would give it a score of 60-65%.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Claypoole

customer_reviews.title: LG products gave always been good for me
customer_reviews.text: LG products gave always been good for me, and this is no exception. My only dislike is, it is EXTREMELY light. While, this is good for someone with a tablet or laptop, it can be annoying since you practically have to hold it when you insert a disc.. since I am using it with a desktop, I have it held in place with Duct-Seal, (LOVE that stuff ).
customer_reviews.author: Lou.

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: This little device has saved me a lot of aggravation. I recently bought a new 2016 automobile that had no CD player. It's not real clear in other reviews, but this device has 2 modes for playing, ODD and TV. The TV mode is actually a USB simulation mode. You hold the tray button for 2 seconds to switch the modes. Now I can use this in my car to play the CD's that I have spent hundreds of dollars on by using the USB mode. Get ready for the great CD phase out. This device is worth double the price in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: WilliamS

customer_reviews.title: Simple addition to ultrabook!
customer_reviews.text: I am changing from a notebook to a ultrabook, the illuminated keyboard is the major reason why. The loss of the optical drive gave me concern until I found this drive on Amazon. I tried it out with the notebook amd have no doubt that it will work just as well with the new ultrabook when it arrives. The enclosed cyberlink software works with Windows 8, if you need any of the orograms it becomes another plus to buy this drive. I recommend it as a new or replacement drive!
customer_reviews.author: WillCro

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: This unit is a recorder; however, it can be used to play a DVD or Blu-Ray if attached to a laptop or computer with player software installed! I works very well and is much faster than any normal DVD recorder because it is designed for high speed recording for back-up!
customer_reviews.author: JMJ

customer_reviews.title: and it works great.
customer_reviews.text: this is an inexpensive CD drive, not fancy but fits my usage does not take up a lot of space , and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: steve naegele

customer_reviews.title: Great choice!
customer_reviews.text: Works amazingly with my computer. I have Windows 10 laptop. I did have to use VLC to watch videos instead of the already installed video player, but that wasn't too much of a problem anyways.
customer_reviews.author: Karling W

customer_reviews.title: ... to say about it other than it works exactly like we expected
customer_reviews.text: not much to say about it other than it works exactly like we expected. I'm not technical but the speed is no different than an external HD in my opinion and the installation was a breeze. Would recommend this if your looking for an affordable and extremely portable option for your laptop or even tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron and Jennifer O'Malley

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Good little DVD drive. I purchased this as a replacement for my laptop's broken DVD drive. I have used it maybe 10 times over the course of 3 months, have traveled with it, and had no problems so far. I do agree with what some people are saying about the tray, where it feels kind of flimsy and needing of support from the bottom when putting a disc in. It is very quick to respond when moving around while watching a movie.
customer_reviews.author: John Mohan

customer_reviews.title: Thus far it works great. I probably won't use it that much
customer_reviews.text: I bought this external drive because my new laptop didn't have a DVD / CD drive. I have only used twice. Thus far it works great. I probably won't use it that much, but it is a great investment to have in the event I need to read a disc. I would definitely recommend it if you are interested in one.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth It
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get an external CD drive for my computer. I don't need to play cds or dvds often and this seemed like a perfect tool. Even though it was hard to open and sometimes was glitchy, it was OK for occasional use. I played cds maybe a dozen times in the last 7 months. And now it simply won't work, won't even boot up. I guess it's the same old story - you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Lavinia Plonka

customer_reviews.title: Satisfactory
customer_reviews.text: It works well enough, only one cord needed so that is convenient. I only used it once, to install software and it was fairly loud, I don't know if it runs constantly like that during a movie but the sound could be quieted by firmly placing my hand on the top of it. It feels a bit flimsy and I wouldn't recommend it for everyday use, however, if it's just for the occasional software that requires a CD/DVD then this does the trick and installs easily on Windows 10.
customer_reviews.author: L. Hitchens

customer_reviews.title: Only worked once... Not sure why it stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I used this once and had no issues. I then stored it in my desk drawer in it's original packaging. A couple months later I pulled it out of the box to use it again and it won't work. My PC is recognizing the drive, but the drive won't read any disks and it will only open via the emergency eject hole. It won't even read the set up disk that came with it. I have no idea why it suddenly stopped running other than that it must not be a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Great little drive
customer_reviews.text: Works great, small size, have moved it to multiple computers and great to add this feature to small laptops that do not have it built in without dedicated hardware.
customer_reviews.author: bugeater

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you know why you're buying it
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure this serves its purpose for some users, however, I was very disappointed for wanting to use it with various TVs as a DVD player. It's just sitting on my dresser at the moment. I would say that if you just needed a DVD drive for occasionally PC use, this would be fine. However, since it's so thin and small, the disc tray is flimsy and care must be taken when using it.
customer_reviews.author: CRRH

customer_reviews.title: MAC compatible and Gamer friendly
customer_reviews.text: My Macbook (2012) Disc drive just broke out of the blue one day. To pass my free time, as limited as it is, I like to play the SIMS for Mac. So I HAD to get something that would play games. This thing works beautifully. Just plug it into the USB and you're set. No lag time or anything. Definitely recommend for MAC users.
customer_reviews.author: Jaclynn Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Good on Mac for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Good on Mac for the price. One annoyance is that the eject button on the drive doesn't work. You have to hit eject from your Mac. But I guess mac drives don't have eject buttons either so that's fair.
customer_reviews.author: Prince Hal

customer_reviews.title: it fits nicely into my laptop bag or my backpack
customer_reviews.text: It works well, it fits nicely into my laptop bag or my backpack, and required no extra setup to use with my computer
customer_reviews.author: Caleb

customer_reviews.title: This CD reader is great. It's light and does exactly what you would ...
customer_reviews.text: This CD reader is great. It's light and does exactly what you would want it to. I have a mac without a CD slot so this beat buying the expensive apple CD reader. It does feel a little bit flimsy (especially compared to the apple version) but I've used it quite a few times and it works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Sabby

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend picking one up
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for 3 years. been throwing it around my room and using it everywhere i go. ts basically indestructible. Highly recommend picking one up.
customer_reviews.author: ryan

customer_reviews.title: Not a happy customer and will not buy again
customer_reviews.text: Of the three of these I bought, Only one still works. One was returned and replaced and the replacement has now stopped working too and now the return window is closed to get that one replaced. Very frustrating. Not a happy customer and will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Kachemak

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality Don't BUY this Product !!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product is crap used it 4 times and stop working tried a new cord, tried 3 computers nothing Poor Quality , Poor Quality Controls don't buy this product !!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: D. Foster

customer_reviews.title: Loud and Delicate
customer_reviews.text: Its loud, and may scratch up your CD if you move it while its playing. Reminds me of the 90's. I would pay a bit more for something not as loud, or delicate. Started to use only for downloading CDs and DVDs on my computer.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi Zou

customer_reviews.title: Works good. Needs only one USB port.
customer_reviews.text: Works good. Does what it's supposed to do. Uses a single USB cable so it's very convenient and can be used directly with my Surface Pro 4 (Which has only one USB port).
customer_reviews.author: BF

customer_reviews.title: Great USB drive
customer_reviews.text: Plugged into USB port and unit was immediately found and drivers installed by W 8.1. Didn't need the enclosed cd drivers. Also the single USB 3.0 supplied enough voltage to drive this unit without need of Y connector.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Campbell Jr.

customer_reviews.title: A good drive for a newer computer lacking these drives
customer_reviews.text: I got this about 6 weeks ago. I am able to use with it's single USB cable on a PC. It is attached to a powered USB 3 hub. I only use it occasionally so am not sure how long it will last. Most new computers seem to lack an optical drive so well worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: M. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Thank you for an amazing Slim Portable DVD recorder
customer_reviews.text: Thank you for an amazing Slim Portable DVD recorder. Is reliable and works perfect. I recommend this to anyone who needs a good Slim Portable DVD Re-Writer.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Cardona

customer_reviews.title: I've used it for ripping CD's and installing PC games and it's been just fine. It's also pretty quiet for a CD/DVD drive
customer_reviews.text: I tried a SAMSUNG one before this and it just kept disconnecting and reconnecting. I've had no issues with this LG one. I've used it for ripping CD's and installing PC games and it's been just fine. It's also pretty quiet for a CD/DVD drive.
customer_reviews.author: Ando Calrissian

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a CD drive on my MacBook Air and, after reading the reviews, I decided to order it. It's a good piece of hardware and works great. I gave it four stars because the instructions for installing it could be confusing for computer users who are novices or apprehensive about installing new hardware/software on their computers.
customer_reviews.author: Panchi

customer_reviews.title: Diasappointed...yet hopeful
customer_reviews.text: This was the third LG DVD R/W I have purchased. The first went missing in a move, the second broke when it fell on the floor and the third was DoA and was returned. I don't know how or why it did not work. However, based on the performance of the first two machines I purchased, I will try again.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Perrin

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with it and would recommend not to purchase this ...
customer_reviews.text: Used it 3 times and now it is a paper weight. Disappointed with it and would recommend not to purchase this product.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Dewey

customer_reviews.title: Very good device and quick shipping.
customer_reviews.text: This optical drive fits perfectly in my tech bag. I recently "saved the day" with it by leaving (the other engineers chose to leave theirs at the office) it in my bag during an onsite visit and using it to burn an image to a disk and rebuild a computer while I was two states away from the home office. Shipping was fast and the device arrived in perfect condition.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Super cheaply made. Disposable.
customer_reviews.text: Super cheaply made. Vibrates like crazy. Press and hold down. Made for single use. Returned. Purchased apple external CD drive. That was made so much better. Would be nice to get decent one for half price of apple.
customer_reviews.author: San Diego Beaches
